metadata.title: RZ/T2L: Can a program that is placed on an external QSPI device be run on the QSPI?

sections.content:
Question:
Can a program that is placed on an external QSPI device be run on the QSPI?
Answer:
XIP operation on an external XIP device is possible for the RZ/T2L. 
If the address of the xSPI space is set to be read from the CPU in the settings of the memory-mapping mode, conversion to an SPI transaction will be performed automatically. 
When a memory size of 576 KB (TCM) + 1.0 M (SYSRAM) is not sufficient, memory size can be extended by XIP access. However, access speeds of XIP access is slower than internal memory (TCM/SYSRAM) access.
Suitable Products
RZ/T2L
